definitions.text: an area in which something acts or operates or has power or control:
examples: the range of a supersonic jet
a piano has a greater range than the human voice
the ambit of municipal legislation
within the compass of this article
within the scope of an investigation
outside the reach of the law
in the political orbit of a world power

definitions.text: the limits within which something can be effective
examples: range of motion
he was beyond the reach of their fire

definitions.text: a large tract of grassy open land on which livestock can graze
examples: they used to drive the cattle across the open range every spring
he dreamed of a home on the range

definitions.text: a series of hills or mountains
examples: the valley was between two ranges of hills
the plains lay just beyond the mountain range

definitions.text: a place for shooting (firing or driving) projectiles of various kinds
examples: the army maintains a missile range in the desert
any good golf club will have a range where you can practice

definitions.text: a variety of different things or activities
examples: he answered a range of questions
he was impressed by the range and diversity of the collection

definitions.text: (mathematics) the set of values of the dependent variable for which a function is defined
examples: the image of f(x) = x^2 is the set of all non-negative real numbers if the domain of the function is the set of all real numbers
within the compass of education

definitions.text: a kitchen appliance used for cooking food
examples: dinner was already on the stove

definitions.text: change or be different within limits
examples: Estimates for the losses in the earthquake range as high as $2 billion
Interest rates run from 5 to 10 percent
The instruments ranged from tuba to cymbals
My students range from very bright to dull

definitions.text: move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
examples: The gypsies roamed the woods
roving vagabonds
the wandering Jew
The cattle roam across the prairie
the laborers drift from one town to the next
They rolled from town to town

definitions.text: have a range; be capable of projecting over a certain distance, as of a gun
examples: This gun ranges over two miles

definitions.text: range or extend over; occupy a certain area
examples: The plants straddle the entire state

definitions.text: lay out orderly or logically in a line or as if in a line
examples: lay out the clothes
lay out the arguments

definitions.text: feed as in a meadow or pasture
examples: the herd was grazing
range the animals in the prairie

definitions.text: assign a rank or rating to
examples: how would you rank these students?
The restaurant is rated highly in the food guide
